results.title: The Discoverers
results.brief_description: A look at several scientific discoveries and techniques and their implications for the future of humanity - the laser, the fuel cell, urethane foam, the petrochemicals, cross-pollination of technologies, a jet piercing drill and micro-circuitry.

results.title: The Digital Environment - Information about Australia's Culture and New Technologies
results.brief_description:
This CD provides an information resource about the intersection of new technologies and cultural activities including: web-publishing, copyright, interoperability, digitisation and other aspects of the Internet age.

Extensive video, reports, discussion papaers, glossaries and other material are available on the CD. There is a powerful index to search thense resources, and it contains hyperlinks to quickly access documents on the Web if your computer has an Internet connection.

results.title: The Diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Brooklyn Juvenile Guidance Centre
results.brief_description: Traces the step-by-step procedure of screening clinical data in order to establish the diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia: a process involving a review of the pertinent historical material, psychological test findings, clinical observations, and the noting of the absence of significant medical, neurological, and laboratory test results, followed by a differential diagnosis to rule out clinical syndromes with which childhood schizophrenia is commonly confused.

results.title: The Desperate heart
results.brief_description: A modern dance solo based on a poem by John Malcolm Brinner describing the loneliness and agony resulting from the loss of a lover. A variety of camera effects and double exposures, combined with the dancing and reading by Valerie Bettis, produces an interesting experiment in modern dance film. Created, spoken and performed by Valerie Bettis; original music by Bernando Segall.

results.title: The Dead Weight of a Quarrel Hangs
results.brief_description: Walid Raad’s Dead weight of a quarrel hangs examines the legacy of the Lebanese Civil War through the stories omitted or seen as unimportant in the official histories. Remnants of film and photography, snapshots and surveillance video footage are transformed to create an archive to “another” Lebanese Civil War.

results.title: The Dead mother = La Madre muerta [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Juanma Bajo Ulloa and Gasteizko Zinema
results.brief_description: A thief, a cold blooded murder, a child witness and a jealous girlfriend provide the scenario for this intense and evocative psycho-thriller by second-time director Juanma Bajo Ulloa (Butterfly wings = Alas de mariposa, 1991). The thief, Ismael (Karra Elejalde) is interrupted during a robbery when the woman of the house unexpectedly returns. Without any hesitation, Ismael proceeds to cold-bloodedly kill the woman and only as he makes his escape does he realise that the murder has been silently witnessed by the woman’s young daughter, Leire. Many years later Leire (Ana Alvarez) and Ismael’s paths cross. Terrified that he may be exposed by the truth, Ismael decides to kidnap Leire and hold her prisoner in his derelict squat, much to his girlfriend Maite’s (Lio) annoyance and frustration. Leire, however, having been traumatised by the witnessing of her mother’s murder, has grown up as a mute. As Ismael’s interest in Liere turns from fear to an almost obsessive attraction, Liere unwittingly finds herself becoming part of a complex and dangerous love triangle, which can only lead to a twisted and violent conclusion, particularly in light of Maite’s extreme jealousy towards Leire. A film of suspense and intrigue peppered with moments of dark humour and acted by a superb cast including Silvia Marso, Elena Irureta, Ramon Barea. Winner of many international film festival awards (Montreal, Stockholm, Sao Paulo etc) including Best Film, Best Director, Best Actress (Ana Alvarez) and Best Actor (Karra Elejalde). In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Date: an interactive movie
results.brief_description: Based on the ‘choose your own adventure’ books from the 1980’s, the outcome of this interactive movie rests with the user. The shy boy central character has managed to score a date with the girl of his dreams - it is up to the user to determine whether he is successful or a miserable failure.

results.title: The Darien conquest
results.brief_description: Combining a sense of adventure and a touch of wit this film is a record of the successful British Trans-Americas Expedition, led by Major Blashford-Snell, through the Darien Gap. It shows the terrible conditions that the men had to go through to achieve this success and also displays the versatility of the two Range-Rover vehicles used.

results.title: The Dangerous years
results.creator_credit: William T. Cartwright and Bud Wiser
results.brief_description: Examines the juvenile crime dilemma facing society today. Through actual on-the-spot scenes, this film reveals the world of the juvenile offender and the often frustrated efforts of the police to stem the tide of juvenile crime.

results.title: The Daily routine (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Charles Silverman, Thomas Nielson, A High and Self Production
results.brief_description: Shows how organising the routine of the day in the primary school aids teachers’ curriculum and cognitive goals, and how a consistent routine allows children to predict the sequence of events, experience different time lengths and the concepts of beginning, middle and end. The film also illustrates how activities and drama during specific times of the day reinforce cognitive goals.
